name: Alternative Content
description: You should provide alternative content for any non-text content so that it can be changed into other forms people need, such as large print, braille, speech, symbols or simpler language.
requirements: Your alternative content should be equivalent to the non-text content.
Your alternative content should be updated when the non-text content is updated.
Your alternative content should be provided in a way that is easy to find and use.
Your alternative content should be provided in a way that is easy to understand.

name: Highlights
description: You should provide the user with the ability to distinguish between selected, focused, and previously visited elements (e.g. links).

name: Time Based Media
description: You should allow the user to adjust the playback (e.g. pause, navigate by time, brightness, volume, etc.) of any time-based media. You should also provide a mechanism to turn off all time-based media.

name: Speech Output
description: You should provide the user with the ability to adjust the volume of speech output. You should also provide a mechanism to turn off all speech output.

name: Text Personalization
description: You should provide the user with the ability to adjust the text spacing, line height, and letter spacing. This may be done using the system settings or a custom control.

name: Orientation in Viewport
description: Content provided in a viewport should be always visible or noticable to the user. This may be done by providing a mechanism to scroll to the content, giving cues to the user, and making sure that focus is never outside of the viewport.

name: Alternative Views
description: You should provide the user with the ability to view content in different ways (e.g. preview of a document, table of contents, etc.).
